repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: Currently when change curwin to a floating window the cursor is missing visual effect is presented in a hidden floating window.

Solution: hide cursor when jump into a hidden floating window. and show cursor after jump to a normal window.


Fix #30553

comment_data.body: Why are these two needed? Don't `busy_stop` and `busy_start` do the same thing?
Yes, after a try it works.  I'm still not familiar with the tui part 😢. So I tried sending invisible/normal. will fix
oh i found it `flush_buf_end` it will check the `tui->is_invisible && !should_invisible(tui)` to show or hide cursor
only `ui_flush` uses this so it should be defined in that scope.

```suggestion
      -- show cursor after switch to a normal window
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -9195,6 +9195,146 @@ describe('float window', function()
                                                   |
         ]])
       end
+
+      -- check cursor visible
+      api.nvim_set_current_win(win)
+      if multigrid then
+        screen:expect({
+          grid = [[
+          ## grid 1
+            [2:----------------------------------------]|*6
+            [3:----------------------------------------]|
+          ## grid 2
+                                                    |
+            {0:~                                       }|*5
+          ## grid 3
+                                                    |
+          ## grid 4 (hidden)
+            {1:          }|
+            {2:~         }|
+          ]], win_viewport={
+          [2] = {win = 1000, topline = 0, botline = 2, curline = 0, curcol = 0, linecount = 1, sum_scroll_delta = 0};
+          [4] = {win = 1001, topline = 0, botline = 2, curline = 0, curcol = 0, linecount = 1, sum_scroll_delta = 0};
+        }, win_viewport_margins={
+          [2] = {
+            bottom = 0,
+            left = 0,
+            right = 0,
+            top = 0,
+            win = 1000
+          },
+          [4] = {
+            bottom = 0,
+            left = 0,
+            right = 0,
+            top = 0,
+            win = 1001
+          }
+        }
+        })
+      else
+        screen:expect({
+          grid = [[
+                                                    |
+            {0:~                                       }|*5
+                                                    |
+          ]]
+        })
+      end
+
+      -- show cursor in cmdline when jump into cmdline from a hidden floating window
+      feed(':')
+      if multigrid then
+        screen:expect({
+          grid = [[
+          ## grid 1
+            [2:----------------------------------------]|*6
+            [3:----------------------------------------]|
+          ## grid 2
+                                                    |
+            {0:~                                       }|*5
+          ## grid 3
+            :^                                       |
+          ## grid 4 (hidden)
+            {1:          }|
+            {2:~         }|
+          ]], win_viewport={
+          [2] = {win = 1000, topline = 0, botline = 2, curline = 0, curcol = 0, linecount = 1, sum_scroll_delta = 0};
+          [4] = {win = 1001, topline = 0, botline = 2, curline = 0, curcol = 0, linecount = 1, sum_scroll_delta = 0};
+        }, win_viewport_margins={
+          [2] = {
+            bottom = 0,
+            left = 0,
+            right = 0,
+            top = 0,
+            win = 1000
+          },
+          [4] = {
+            bottom = 0,
+            left = 0,
+            right = 0,
+            top = 0,
+            win = 1001
+          }
+        }
+        })
+      else
+        screen:expect({
+          grid = [[
+                                                    |
+            {0:~                                       }|*5
+            :^                                       |
+          ]]
+        })
+      end
+      feed('<ESC>')
+
+      -- show cursor after swith to a normal window

comment_data.body: yes. I wrote it like this at first. but I was afraid of breaking any rules so I moved it to the top

```suggestion
      -- 
      -- Cursor visibility:
      --
      -- Cursor is not visible in a hide=true floating window.
```

comment_data.body: The branching here doesn't seem correct. When switching from a hidden floating window to a non-hidden floating window, the cursor isn't remade visible.
Why don't you merge these two conditions?

comment_regular_data.body: This doesn't handle the case when using `nvim_win_set_config` on current window
and into cmdline from a hidden floating window the cursor need shown on cmdline or keep hide ? if need shown `command_line_enter` also need process right ?
Hmm, maybe the change should be done in `ui_comp_grid_cursor_goto()` instead?

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(float): cursor visible in "hidden" floating window
